comments.body: If the user requests a future for a partition that wasn't included in the request, I think we should raise `IllegalArgumentException` directly to the user instead of a future.
The deal here is that we couldn’t throw exception in a whenComplete call as it won’t populate to the current caller.
It might be worth mentioning that if there is a partition-level failure, then the first one is returned.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +62,66 @@
    /**
     * Return a future which succeeds only if all the deletions succeed.
     * If not, the first partition error shall be returned.
     */
